tasks.title: Remove adyntelPicsApi credentials file
tasks.description: Delete the unused adyntelPicsApi.credentials.ts file and clean up any remaining references to it in the codebase.
tasks.details:
The adyntelPicsApi.credentials.ts file appears to be an obsolete credential file that duplicates the functionality of AdyntelApi.credentials.ts. Investigation shows:

1. The file at /Users/andreibaloleanu/adyntel-n8n-new/credentials/adyntelPicsApi.credentials.ts contains the same AdyntelApi class as the main credentials file
2. The adyntelPics node in nodes/adyntelPics/adyntelPics.node.ts references 'AdyntelApi' credentials, not 'adyntelPicsApi'
3. The package.json only registers the main AdyntelApi credentials file in the n8n configuration
4. No references to 'picsapi', 'adyntelPicsApi', or similar variants were found in the codebase

Implementation steps:
1. Verify the file is truly unused by conducting a final search for any references
2. Delete the adyntelPicsApi.credentials.ts file using the file system
3. Ensure no import statements or configuration references point to this file
4. Confirm the adyntelPics node continues to work with the main AdyntelApi credentials

This cleanup will reduce code duplication and eliminate confusion about which credentials file to use for the Adyntel API integration.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Search the entire codebase for any references to 'adyntelPicsApi' or similar to confirm no dependencies exist
2. Delete the adyntelPicsApi.credentials.ts file
3. Run 'npm run build' to ensure the build process completes successfully without errors
4. Run 'npm run lint' to verify no linting errors are introduced
5. Verify that the adyntelPics node still references the correct 'AdyntelApi' credentials in its configuration
6. Confirm the package.json n8n.credentials array only contains the intended AdyntelApi credentials file path
7. Test that no broken imports or missing file errors occur during the build process
tasks.expansionPrompt: This task does not need expansion as it's a simple file deletion operation.

tasks.title: Remove adyntelPics node directory and all associated files
tasks.description: Delete the entire adyntelPics node directory and remove all references to it from the project configuration and build system.
tasks.details:
The adyntelPics node is a duplicate implementation that is no longer needed. Analysis shows:

1. The adyntelPics node directory at nodes/adyntelPics/ contains:
   - adyntelPics.node.ts: Contains the same Adyntel class as the main node with identical functionality
   - adyntelpics.node.json: Node metadata file
   - adyntelpics.svg: Icon file

2. The main Adyntel node at nodes/Adyntel/ is the correct implementation that should remain

3. The package.json only registers the main Adyntel node in the n8n configuration, confirming adyntelPics is not used

4. Both nodes implement identical functionality - making POST requests to api.adyntel.com/facebook

Implementation steps:
1. Delete the entire nodes/adyntelPics/ directory and all its contents
2. Verify no import statements or references to adyntelPics exist in other files
3. Confirm the build system doesn't reference the deleted files
4. Ensure the dist/ folder doesn't contain any compiled adyntelPics files
5. Update any documentation that might reference the removed node

This cleanup will eliminate code duplication and maintain only the properly configured Adyntel node.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Search the entire codebase for any remaining references to 'adyntelPics' or 'adyntelpics' (case-insensitive)
2. Delete the nodes/adyntelPics/ directory and verify all files are removed
3. Run 'npm run build' to ensure the build process completes without errors
4. Run 'npm run lint' to verify no linting errors are introduced
5. Check that no compiled files for adyntelPics exist in the dist/ folder
6. Verify the main Adyntel node at nodes/Adyntel/ remains functional
7. Confirm the package.json n8n.nodes configuration still only points to the main Adyntel node
8. Test that the n8n package builds correctly and contains only the intended node
tasks.expansionPrompt: Break down this cleanup task into verification, deletion, testing, and validation steps to ensure no build system dependencies are broken when removing the duplicate node directory.
